  1. # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
  2. """
  3. Edit Toolbar middleware
  4. """
  5. from cms.cms_toolbar import CMSToolbar
  6. from django.http import HttpResponse
  7. from django.template.loader import render_to_string
  10. def toolbar_plugin_processor(instance, placeholder, rendered_content, original_context):
  11. original_context.push()
  12. data = {
  13. 'instance': instance,
  14. 'rendered_content': rendered_content
  15. }
  16. original_context.update(data)
  17. output = render_to_string('cms/toolbar/placeholder_wrapper.html', original_context)
  18. original_context.pop()
  19. return output
  21. class ToolbarMiddleware(object):
  22. """
  23. Middleware to set up CMS Toolbar.
  24. """
  26. def process_request(self, request):
  27. """
  28. If we should show the toolbar for this request, put it on
  29. request.toolbar. Then call the request_hook on the toolbar.
  30. """
  31. if 'edit' in request.GET and not request.session.get('cms_edit', False):
  32. request.session['cms_edit'] = True
  33. request.toolbar = CMSToolbar(request)
  35. def process_view(self, request, view_func, view_args, view_kwarg):
  36. response = request.toolbar.request_hook()
  37. if isinstance(response, HttpResponse):
  38. return response
